message.content:
cs.RO, cs.HC, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.CV 

Reasoning: 
- cs.RO (Robotics): The paper focuses on developing a brain-computer interface (BCI) system for controlling a mobile robotic service assistant. 
- cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction): The paper addresses the need for user-friendly interfaces for controlling robotic systems, particularly for users with limited communication skills. 
- cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing): The paper involves non-invasive neuronal signal recording and decoding for the BCI system. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper discusses high-level task planning and motion planning for the robotic system. 
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): The paper mentions environment perception as one of the components of the BCI system.
